definition: son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: Another wave came, and it flipped the raft upside down.
sentences.chinese: 另一波浪頭打了過來，筏子也給掀翻了。

sentences.english: They would tie and raft their boats up to have party.
sentences.chinese: 他們將把他們的小船綁在一起，紮成筏子舉行聚會。

sentences.english: We also wish to demonstrate that rafts can be navigated.
sentences.chinese: 我們也希望證明筏子是能夠航海的。

sentences.english: And the control panel telling us where we are, where we are heading and what speed we are achieving.
sentences.chinese: 控制儀表會告訴我們筏子的方位，航向和航速。

sentences.english: My raft drifts if it is not steered.
sentences.chinese: 我的小筏子如不被駕駛，即會漂走。

sentences.english: The raft floated out to sea.
On our raft we have witnessed this aberration only too well.
sentences.chinese: 我們在筏子上對這些反常天氣見得太多了。

sentences.english: The corn stalks are woven into a raft.
sentences.chinese: 玉米杆兒被編成了一隻筏子。

sentences.english: Build your own raft and take to the water by following these instructions.
sentences.chinese: 自己造一個筏子，依照本指南下水。

sentences.english: In this massive raft, we had nothing to worry about.
sentences.chinese: 在這麼大的筏子裏，我沒什麼好擔心的。

sentences.english: You blow is on a raft and sail the Atlantic.
sentences.chinese: 你的機會是用一艘筏子在大西洋上航行。

sentences.english: They rafted  their neighbours across the river.
sentences.chinese: 他們用筏子將鄰居們運過河去。

sentences.english: I sprang to my feet, and leaped, stamping the coracle under water.
sentences.chinese: 我縱身一跳，將小筏子踩到了水中。

definition: variant of 漁網|渔网[yu2 wang3]
